title: [BUG] SkiaSharp Gray8 decoding returns null
body:
**Description**

In SkiaSharp `1.60.3` loading an 8bit png would result in a bitmap with `BytesPerPixel == 1`. 
In `1.68.0`, `BytesPerPixel == 4`

Apparently now we need to pass in the codec when decoding to tell Skia it is an 8 bit image.
https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/694#issuecomment-441078401

**Code**

```
// bytes = File.ReadAllBytes(....)
var stream = new MemoryStream(bytes);
var codec = SKCodec.Create(stream);
var imageInfo = new SKImageInfo(codec.Info.Width, codec.Info.Height, SKColorType.Gray8);
var bitmap = SKBitmap.Decode(codec, imageInfo);
```


**Expected Behavior**

`BytesPerPixel == 1`

**Actual Behavior**

`bitmap == null`

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  `1.68.0`
- Last known good version: `1.60.3`
- IDE:  `Visual Studio Code`
- Platform Target Frameworks: `netcoreapp3.0`
